title: Woman's Board Lecture: Carrie Mae Weems
title_display: Woman's Board Lecture: Carrie Mae Weems
short_description: Hear from acclaimed artist Carrie Mae Weems on the ways her work engages with ideas of race, gender, and American identity. Note: This ticket is for the lecture and does not include access to the luncheon that follows.
list_description: Hear from acclaimed artist Carrie Mae Weems on the ways her work engages with ideas of race, gender, and American identity.
description:
Join us for the 2022 Woman’s Board Lecture + Luncheon and hear from acclaimed artist Carrie Mae Weems on the ways her work engages with ideas of race, gender, and American identity.

Since its formation in 1952, the Woman’s Board has provided annual support to the museum and has underwritten educational programming for various audiences, including families, students and educators, and the general public.

Note: A lecture-only ticket does not include access to the luncheon that follows.

Carrie Mae Weems

Over the course of her nearly 40-year career, Weems has created a complex body of work that helps us better understand our present moment by examining our collective past. She has received multiple awards, grants, and fellowships, and her work is held in public and private collections around the world, including the the Art Institute of Chicago; Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York; Tate Modern, London; the Museum of Modern Art, New York; and Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles.

So that you and all our guests can enjoy the experience safely, all museum visiting policies current at the time of the event must be observed.

To learn more about the Woman’s Board, call (312) 443-3628 or email womansboard@artic.edu
